metadata.title: CVE-2016-3616 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
The cjpeg utility in libjpeg allows remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (NULL pointer dereference and application crash) or executearbitrary code via a crafted file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-3616` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libjpeg-turbo-progs - 1.5.1-0ubuntu1
libjpeg-turbo-test - 1.5.1-0ubuntu1
libjpeg-turbo8 - 1.5.1-0ubuntu1
libturbojpeg - 1.5.1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

libjpeg-progs - 1:9b-2
libjpeg9 - 1:9b-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libjpeg-turbo package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.5.1-0ubuntu1').
libjpeg9 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:9b-2').
